creator: micke@screemer.nu
text:
Hi there, I've had Apache 2.xx installed on Windows XP Professional for a long
time and it has been running really great.

Just recently I installed the net install of SP2 for XP.
After that upgrade I've noticed that for some reason the Apache server don't
seem to serve sites fast any more.

When someone tries to access a site I am hosting what seem to happend is it
initiates a transfer and then just stops.

I have tried "Win32DisableAcceptEx" and I've also tried to "EnableSendfile off"

I have disabled all the security stuff in SP2 like the firewall and security
center, also the DEP. I used to have a firewall called Tiny firewall installed
but that's uninstalled now.

I can see no reason to this problem and I have searched thru bugreports and been
googeling allot but I can find no information about this.

I have 4 sites on the server and all are the same.

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text:
Can we have some more details?

How slow is slower?  1 Page per second max?  What did you serve before?

Also, I believe some of this is expected with SP2. They did lots of things to
make it 'safer', without worrying about performance too much.  Its possible we
can make Apache faster in SP2, but we really need some details on what happens!

Sure you can have details..

After installing SP2 i could serve about 1 page a minute and most of the time
about 1 page / 10 minutes.

I used to get allot of these untill I added "Win32DisableAcceptEx"
" The semaphore timeout period has expired.  : winnt_accept: Asynchronous
AcceptEx failed. "

Now I get this in the general error log when I start the server.
[Fri Aug 20 15:48:34 2004] [notice] Child 4396: Exit event signaled. Child
process is ending.
[Fri Aug 20 15:48:35 2004] [notice] Child 4396: Released the start mutex
[Fri Aug 20 15:48:36 2004] [notice] Child 4396: Waiting for 64 worker threads to
exit.
[Fri Aug 20 15:49:04 2004] [notice] Parent: Forcing termination of child process
332 

Also I've learned that the tcpip.sys in SP2 is stripped to 10 simultanious
openings per port. There is a patch that fixes that and resets it to 16000000+
and I've even tried to apply that.

CPU usage is really low and mem usage the same..

I hope this can be of some help..

I had to change to another web server today since my hosts can't stay down.
But I'll be glad to give more info if I can.
creator: micke@screemer.nu

text:
I have this problem also, but only when I use the DNS name to access the site, 
if I use the ip to go directly to it, things seem to run much smoother 
(although I still notice a little craziness).  Do you get the same performance 
if you access the site directly?
